title: San Francisco Style 2BR,Sm Pet Cons,Sh Yard/Laundry(780 Guerrero#10)
posting_body: ['3rd Floor 2BR/1BA Apartment', '* $3,495/month annual lease', '* Shared yard', '* Shared laundry', '* Small pet considered', '*', 'Available:', 'Now', 'Pictures are from the similar unit', 'OPEN HOUSE: Please call', 'show contact info', 'ADDRESS:', '780 Guerrero #10 (Mask required)', 'San Francisco style 2BR/1BA third floor apartment in the Mission Dolores district.', 'Floors are hardwood except in kitchen and bath.', 'Heat is via steam radiators.', 'The two rooms at the back of the apartment both work well as bedrooms, but if both as used as such, the kitchen has to function as the living room as well.', 'Kitchen has all stainless appliances, including gas stove, microwave, dishwasher, black marble counters, a goodly number of cabinets as well as built in shelving.', 'The refrigerator is in a small room located off the kitchen which can be used as a modest pantry.', 'One bedroom has a large walk-in closet.', 'Bath has shower-over-tub with sliding glass doors.', 'There is a large hall closet near the entrance to the apartment.', 'Shared yard is concrete with bike rack, potted plants.', 'Building has coin operated washer and dryer.', 'Building is on Guerrero, four blocks equidistant from shopping and dining on 16th and 24th Streets.', "It's just one block to the south end of Dolores Park.", 'Walk Score is 97, Transit Score is 92.', 'Lots of transportation options within easy walking distance include 16th and 24th Street BART stations, J-Church MUNI, and bus lines 14, 22, 33, 49.', "Tenant pays a one-time broker's fee.", 'Everest Mwamba', 'DRE# 01717299', 'Kenney & Everest Real Estate', 'DRE# 01984640', 'show contact info', 'office', 'Apply at: <URL>', 'Leasing and Real Estate: Our Family Business for Over 100 Years.', 'This unit is a rental unit subject to the San Francisco Rent Ordinance, which limits evictions without just cause, and which states that any waiver by a tenant of their rights under the Rent Ordinance is void as contrary to public policy.']
